com.apriori.util

Interface Cloner<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of object that can be cloned
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface Cloner<T>
    An object that can clone other objects.
    See Also:
    Cloners

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T clone(T o)
      Clones an object.

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        T clone(T o)
        Clones an object. Cloning an object copies it, usually a "deep" copy. Cloning can be performed on arguments passed to an interface during verification by an InterfaceVerifier. This is necessary in the event that the implementation under test mutates the incoming argument. That way both the test implementation and reference implementation receive proper incoming values (otherwise, one implementation may receive "different" arguments due to the values having been mutated by the other implementation).

        It should not be necessary for implementors of this interface to check whether the specified object is null. It should never be null. It is expected that, if invoked to clone a null reference, a NullPointerException will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        o - The object being cloned
        Returns:
        The clone
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the specified object is null
        CloningException - If any step in the cloning operation fails
